abstract: The performer, who admits fabricating parts of his own reporting on working conditions in China, attacked the All Things D conference for going easy on Apple’s Tim Cook.
snippet: The performer, who admits fabricating parts of his own reporting on working conditions in China, attacked the All Things D conference for going easy on Apple’s Tim Cook.
lead_paragraph: Mike Daisey was last seen apologizing for exaggerations and falsehoods in his influential one-man show “The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs” about the working conditions at the Chinese factories that make many Apple devices.

headline.main: Mike Daisey Returns to the Apple Story, With Journalists as Targets
